bibl.title: Letter from Walter M. Daniel to American Consul-General, September 19, 1923

div1.p: Daniels informs the American Consul-General that a seaman was removed from the ship and subsequently died of malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Walter M. Daniel to American Consul-General, September 19, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
UNITED FRUIT COMPANY
Havana, Cuba
September 19th, 1923.
American Consul-General,
Horter Building,
H a v a n a.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
For your information would advise that on arrival of the
S/S “SARAMACCA” at this port yesterday, September 18th, from Puerto
Barrios, Guatemala, consular passenger James Roudabush, American, 37
years of age, able seaman and in transit from Puerto Barrios to New
Orleans, was ordered removed from the “SARAMACCA” suffering from an
illness subsequently diagnosed as malarial fever and sent to the Las
Animas hospital where we are advised he died at 8:30 p. m.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, (Signed) Walter M. Daniel
General Agent CC - Dr. Richard Wilson,
American Health Service,
Machina Pier, Havana.
CC - Mr. C. H. Ellis, Vice-President, N.O.
Dr. P. Francis Murphy, Port Medical Officer, N.O.
Dr. W. E. Deeks, Gen. Mgr. Medical Department, N.Y.
Mr. A. H. Sayers, Gen. Claim Agent, N.Y.
Mr. J. H. White, Local Claim Agent, N.O.
